svg:

Backend Project 1. For development process, we should use nodemon as dev dependencies so it can be installed as "npm i -D nodemon" 2. For production grade , we must install prettier extension for project to resolve conflict while uploading on github. It is dev dependencies so "npm i -D prettier" . After installation of prettier there is need of adding files to work them accordingly.The file that needed to be added is ".prettierrc". This file should contain :the next file is ".prettierignore" . This file includes which files to be not used with prettier.Files and folders like .env , /node_modules , /dist , /.vscode etc can be included. { "singleQuote": false, "bracketSpacing": true, "tabWidth": 2, "semi": true, "trailingComma": "es5"}3. we should also make a .env file for keeping our file as secrets. The .env file should be configure with dotenv.config({ path:"path_to_.env"})4. We should generally use following middleware for various purposes: // json parser middlewareapp.use(express.json({ limit: "20kb" }));// urlencoded parser middlewareapp.use(express.urlencoded({ extended: true, limit: "20kb", }));// public folder middleware. It makes static folder available for public accessapp.use(express.static("public"));// cookie parser middlware for accesing and updating the cookies on client sideapp.use(cookieParser());4. We can use our own utility function to handle frequently used concepts. For example , we need to use async function from time to time . So , we can add utility for asynchronousfunction. // try catch block to handle async functionconst asyncHandler = (fn) => async (req, res, next) => { try { await fn(req, res, next); } catch (error) { res.status(error.code || 500).json({ success: false, message: error.message || "Internal Server Error", }); }};// handle async function for promisesconst asyncHandler = (fn) => (req, res, next) => { return Promise.resolve(fn(req, res, next)).catch((err) => next(err));};5. For consistency we need to standardized error and response as same format : For this we have to createa class .NODE js provides a class Error with various property which can be used as for our own error standardization.class ApiError extends Error { constructor( statusCode, message = "Something went wrong", stack = "", errors = [] ) { super(message); this.statusCode = statusCode; this.message = message; this.sucess = false; this.errors = errors; if (stack) { this.stack = stack; } else { Error.captureStackTrace(this, this.constructor); } }}class ApiResponse { constructor(statusCode, data, message = "Success") { this.statusCode = statusCode; this.data = data; this.message = message; this.success = statusCode<400; }}export {ApiResponse}
